attributes.action: make provision for women who have foolishly opted to pay the married women's national insurance contributions to receive a state pension equivalent to what it would be if they had not made that choice. Married women are the only class of people who have been put in a position where they could mistakenly sign away their full pension entitlement.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: For example: my wife was told by her employer as a young married mother that she only needed to pay full contributions if she wanted to be able to claim unemployment benefit or sickness benefit; her pension was covered by my contributions. In later years she was offered the choice of paying a full contribution, but no figures were given. She mistakenly believed full contributions would then be about £19 per week and she was only earning about £50. She is three years older than I am. At age 60 she received 47 pence per week graduated pension. At age 68 she received 2/3 of a basic pension as the wife of a 65-year-old man. She worked from age 15 to age 61, except for two years.
